alert.note: Alert for Chester (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 7:51PM EST until January 10 at 5:42PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northern Delaware, including the following county, New Castle, southern New Jersey, including the following counties, Gloucester and Salem, and southeast Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Chester, Delaware and Montgomery. * WHEN...Until midnight EST tonight. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 750 PM EST, local law enforcement reported numerous road closures as an area of very heavy rainfall moves across the warned area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. - For East Branch Brandywine Creek at Downingtown: At 6:45pm the stage was 7.06 feet and rising. Flood Stage is 7 feet. For French Creek at Phoenixville: At 7:30pm the stage was 8.48 feet and rising. Flood Stage is 8 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
